title: Man accused in Warrensville Heights barbershop slayings has charges added
content:
CLEVELAND (AP) — A 20-year-old man facing capital murder charges in the slayings of three people at a suburban Cleveland barbershop has been accused in two other gang-related shootings.
Northeast Ohio Media Group reports that the new charges against Douglas Shine Jr. stem from a pair of January shootings targeting a man eventually killed during the Feb. 5 shooting at Chalk Linez barbershop in Warrensville Heights.
Court documents filed last week in Cuyahoga County show Shine is accused of firing at four people, including 23-year-old Walter Barfield, in a Jan. 22 drive-by. He’s accused of shooting at Barfield again two days later at another location.
Barfield was killed at the barbershop, along with two other men. Prosecutors will seek the death penalty for Shine if he’s convicted of aggravated murder.
